response:
A young adult with multifocal CNS involvement of the optic nerve and medulla/cerebellar connections, predominantly central signs and minimal vascular risk factors is most consistent with an inflammatory demyelinating disorder such as multiple sclerosis; neuromyelitis optica spectrum disorder is an important alternative given optic and brainstem involvement, while structural or vascular medullary lesions and other inflammatory brainstem encephalitides remain key exclusions.

differential_diagnosis = ["Relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis", "Neuromyelitis optica spectrum disorder", "Left vertebral artery or posterior inferior cerebellar artery medullary infarction (Wallenberg-plus syndrome)", "Left medullary or cervicomedullary junction tumour (e.g. low-grade glioma or meningioma)", "Autoimmune or infectious brainstem encephalitis (e.g. neurosarcoidosis, Bickerstaff brainstem encephalitis)"]
